page.title: 01BLOCK 04440108
page.content: This block is situated upon a peninsula bordered by Southampton Water and the river Hamble. It consists of a combination of modern council estate,Victorian villages,open farmland and inland water. Employment is mainly allied to shipbuilding but there are many self employed chiefly in the building trade. The block is divided almost equally by the borough boundary Southampton and Eastleigh. Much of the recreational activity centres upon the excellent sailing facilities. The area boasts an ancient ruined monastery at Netley and a castle rebuilt in the 19th. century on the site of an earlier fortification.
